definitions: the action of mooring a boat or ship to the shore or to an anchor

examples.text: regulations prohibiting the long-term moorage of vessels

shortDefinitions: action of mooring a boat or ship to shore or to anchor

definitions: a place where a boat or ship is moored

examples.text: I left the boat on a knee-deep moorage for two summers
the marinas provide moorage for 1,200 boats

shortDefinitions: place where boat or ship is moored

definitions: a fee charged for mooring a boat or ship

examples.text: the boat owner hadn't paid the moorage

shortDefinitions: fee charged for mooring boat or ship
